page.title: 06Farming Today :Part two
page.content: Hereford x Friesian are kept on most farms predominantly not engaged in milk selling. Calves are reared to 18 months and sold for fattening else- where. There are four Friesian herds. {Milk quotas introduced in April 1984 {severely affected the income of dairy {farmers.}The milk goes to Minsterley Creamery. Silage and hay are made for winter fodder, also oats & barley are grown. There is a flourishing interest in {Anglo-Nubian goats.}Sizes of herds vary between 2-28. Milk is produced for home consumption or frozen and marketed. One farm breeds Saddleback x Landrace pigs which are sold as weaners. The family pig is fattened on 5 holdings. There is a{tendency nowadays for {unviable farms to be sold & added to {larger units.
